description: Erection of first floor side and part single/part two-storey rear extension
decision_conditions: By virtue of its excessive bulk, scale and mass, the proposed two storey rear element of the proposal would constitute a dominant and disproportionate addition in relation to the host dwelling and surrounding area, detracting from the character and appearance of the host property and the surrounding area conflicting with Policies  D3 of the London Plan 2021, DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012 and Policy Guidance 34 of the Council's Residential Design SPD, 2013.

The proposed two storey rear element of the proposal by reason of its siting, excessive bulk, scale and mass and lack of sufficient separation distance would have an unacceptable adverse impact upon the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining property No 126 Hamilton Avenue by reason of an overbearing appearance. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policies  D3 of the London Plan 2021, DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
